author: Nguyen Xuan Quynh
description: Vietnam’s Communist Party chief To Lam will kick off a three-day state visit to North Korea on Thursday, marking the first trip to Pyongyang by the country’s most powerful leader in almost 20 years.
title: Vietnam’s Leader Makes Rare Visit to North Korea to Bolster Ties

author: Jim Wyss
description: A soccer match between Argentina and Puerto Rico is being relocated to Florida from Chicago, according to people familiar with the decision, a day after the Texas National Guard arrived in the third-largest US city.
title: Argentina Soccer Match Pulled From Chicago Amid Troop Tension

author: Alicia Diaz, Joe Mathieu
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson said he hasn’t reviewed a White House Budget Office proposal to withhold back pay to federal workers furloughed during the shutdown, a controversial plan that has been criticized for violating the law.
title: Johnson Says He Hasn’t Studied Trump Plan to Withhold Back Pay

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: Donald Trump will undergo a routine physical exam on Friday, the White House announced, following questions about the president’s health after he developed noticeable bruising and swelling in recent months.
title: Trump to Undergo Regular Physical Exam at Walter Reed on Friday

author: Alexandre Rajbhandari, Nicola M White
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission is probing Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Co. over accounting practices for its investments, according to the Wall Street Journal.
title: SEC Probes MassMutual for Accounting Practices, WSJ Reports

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On this episode of Trumponomics, we look at how the underlying dynamics in Washington have changed and what it means for the economy.
title: Why This US Government Shutdown Is Different

author: Lucy White
description: Keir Starmer met with a key architect of India’s digital ID program, as the British prime minister sought guidance on implementing a similar system in the UK.
title: Starmer Looks to India for Example on UK Plan for Digital ID

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump instructed members of his cabinet to move to declare Antifa a foreign terrorist organization at an event that highlighted his efforts to crack down on the loose collective of far left-wing groups.
title: Trump Looks to Label Antifa as a Foreign Terrorist Organization

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: A federal appeals court says the Trump administration can maintain control of the Oregon National Guard while the state’s legal case against the effort proceeds, but the administration is still blocked from deploying troops in the state for now.
title: Court Lifts Oregon Guard Ruling, but Deployment Ban Remains

author: Nick Wadhams
description: The Defense Department is sending an “unprecedented message of intimidation” with its latest proposal for rules governing how media cover the Pentagon, according to the group that represents news outlets reporting there.
title: Pentagon Press Group Condemns Proposed Limits on Media Access

author: Matthew Bristow
description: The most recent boat to be blown up by US forces in the Caribbean may have been Colombian, President Gustavo Petro said.
title: Petro Says Last Boat Bombed in Caribbean May Have Been Colombian

author: Gregory Korte
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, domestic policy reporter Gregory Korte looks at the growing impact of the government shutdown. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Government Shutdown Enters Day 8, and It’s Getting Real

author: Brooke Sutherland
description: Jonathan Bush, who stepped down under pressure as chief executive officer of Athenahealth Inc. amid allegations of misconduct involving women, is entering the crowded race to become the next governor of Maine.
title: Bush Cousin Who Clashed With Hedge Fund Runs for Maine Governor

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Jonathan McKernan, an attorney who specialized in banking and consumer financial laws, has won US Senate confirmation to the top domestic finance job at the Treasury Department.
title: Banking Attorney McKernan Confirmed to US Domestic Finance Job

author: Brian Platt, Robert Tuttle
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney pitched deeper cooperation with the US on energy, including a possible revival of the Keystone XL pipeline project, in his meeting with President Donald Trump on Tuesday.
title: Carney Pitched Trump on Energy Alliance, Including Keystone XL

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The IRS will furlough just under half of its staff and pause most of the agency’s taxpayer services as gridlock in Congress pushes the government shutdown into its second week.
title: IRS Furloughs Nearly Half Its Workforce as US Shutdown Drags On

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Andrea Palasciano
description: Austria is delaying the European Union’s latest Russia sanctions package, demanding the bloc unfreeze assets linked to tycoon Oleg Deripaska to compensate one of its banks, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Austria Stalls Russia Sanctions Over Raiffeisen Compensation

author: William Horobin, Samy Adghirni, Andrea Palasciano
description: Outgoing Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu said he made progress in negotiations with France’s parliamentary groups and expects President Emmanuel Macron to be in a position to name a new premier in the next 48 hours.
title: Lecornu Says Macron to Be Able to Name New Premier in 48 Hours

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Mali’s junta has sacked a number of high-ranking military commanders after their involvement in alleged acts of indiscipline.
title: Mali Dismisses a Number of Military Officials Over Indiscipline

author: Anna J Kaiser, Michael Smith
description: Miami Mayor Francis Suarez is lining up a lot of star power before leaving office, emceeing a business conference with heavy hitters like President Donald Trump, soccer legend Lionel Messi, Hollywood star Will Smith and hedge fund billionaire Ken Griffin.
title: Miami Mayor Lures Trump, Messi, Griffin as Part of Final Act

author: Nicolle Yapur
description: Argentina investors are increasing bets that President Javier Milei will devalue the peso after midterm elections this month as the government depletes its reserves to prop up the ailing currency.
title: Milei’s Dollar Sales Bolster the Peso But Stoke Devaluation Bets

author: Anisah Shukry, Netty Idayu Ismail
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim addressed a pro-Palestinian rally Wednesday night where he sharply criticized Israel’s actions in Gaza, remarks that come weeks before he hosts a key Israeli ally, US President Donald Trump.
title: Anwar Appearance at Pro-Palestine Rally in Malaysia Risks US Ire

author: Isobel Finkel, Maria Gabriella Pezzo, Vivien Jones
description: With Britain’s venerable Conservatives desperate to avoid political oblivion, delegates at the party’s annual conference found themselves prompted to seek guidance from a prime minister who left office 35 years ago. “Ask the Iron Lady,” urged a poster from the Conservative Women’s Association.
title: UK Tories Summon Up Thatcher With Tax-Slashing Plan for Survival

author: Allegra Stratton
description: Kemi Badenoch promised to scrap stamp duty in a surprise offer
title: Allegra Stratton: Is This An Actual Vote Winner?

author: Michael Cohen
description: South Africa’s main municipalities, with the exception of Cape Town, are in a “death spiral,” spending way too much money on administrative staff and too little on maintaining and building infrastructure, a deputy finance minister warned.
title: South African Cities in Death Spiral, Deputy Finance Chief Warns

author: Kate Sullivan
description: With the stroke of his pen last week, President Donald Trump offered the tiny Gulf nation of Qatar a prize many nations have sought but few have been given: a security guarantee pledging US help if it comes under attack.
title: Trump Gave Qatar a Security Guarantee and Isn’t Explaining Why

author: Kamlesh Bhuckory
description: Madagascar President Andry Rajoelina appointed three ministers to oversee the Indian Ocean island nation’s security forces, in sweeping changes aimed at containing intensifying youth-led protests.
title: Madagascar Leader Overhauls Security Team Amid Deadly Protests

author: David Voreacos, Erik Larson
description: The federal judge appointed by President Donald Trump who temporarily blocked his plan to send troops to Portland, Oregon, has triggered his fury and a legal battle that’s testing the limits on using the military in American cities.
title: Trump Gets Fresh Chance to Fight Judge That He Picked in Oregon

author: Miranda Davis, Shruti Singh
description: President Donald Trump said Illinois Governor JB Pritzker and Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson should be put behind bars, a threat that comes a day after the Texas National Guard arrived in the third-largest US city.
title: Trump Threatens to Lock Up Pritzker as Troops Arrive in Chicago

author: Chris Strohm, Jimmy Jenkins
description: Former FBI Director James Comey pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to charges that he lied to lawmakers and obstructed a congressional proceeding.
title: Former FBI Director Comey Pleads Not Guilty to US Charges

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland will only grant refugee status to Ukrainians from regions that are occupied by Russia or where fighting is taking place, the government said after parliament passed a bill from right-wing lawmakers.
title: Switzerland Tightens Admission Criteria for Ukrainian Refugees

author: William Horobin
description: France’s outgoing finance minister, Roland Lescure, said the country is on course to meet its deficit reduction target and that he’s confident feuding political parties can still deliver a 2026 budget.
title: France’s Lescure Says on Track to Meet 2025 Deficit Target

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German lawmakers approved more than €7 billion ($8.1 billion) in defense orders ranging from Eurofighter jets to boats for naval special forces to tank-busting ammunition as the government pushes ahead with its military buildup.
title: German Lawmakers Back €7 Billion in Big-Ticket Defense Projects

author: Sara Sjolin
description: Greenland’s prime minister called on the European Union to deepen cooperation on connectivity in the Arctic territory to prevent “unauthorized parties” from disrupting its digital infrastructure.
title: Greenland Prime Minister Asks EU Help to Secure Digital Links, Block Threats

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany will eke out meager expansion of 0.2% this year before growth strengthens to 1.3% in 2026 supported by tens of billions of euros in fiscal stimulus, according to revised government projections.
title: Germany Sees Growth Accelerating in More Optimistic Forecasts

author: Alex Morales
description: Kemi Badenoch promised to scrap the tax levied on the purchase of Britons’ main homes as she sought to turn around her party’s fortunes a little over a year from a historic election defeat.
title: Badenoch Vows to Scrap UK’s Stamp Duty Tax on Home Purchases

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Having burned through billions of dollars in reserves, Argentina’s government is getting creative as it looks to defend the peso ahead of crucial midterm elections later this month.
title: Argentina Pulls Out All Stops in Milei’s Defense of Fragile Peso

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia has reported a growing number of drone attacks deep inside its territory, with some reaching nearly 2,000 kilometers (1,200 miles) from the Ukrainian border, further testing the country’s air defenses as the war expands.
title: Drone Attacks Seen 2,000 Kilometers Inside Russia Expand War

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul dismissed the need for Donald Trump to mediate a peace deal with Cambodia, distancing himself from the US president’s efforts to win a Nobel Peace Prize.
title: Thailand Says Cambodia’s Moves Are Key for Peace, Not Trump’s Mediation

author: Barbara Nascimento, Cristiane Lucchesi
description: The head of Latin America’s largest water utility in ready to start making deals now that the newly privatized Brazilian company has met a key benchmark for the expansion of services set by the state.
title: CEO of Latin America’s Top Water Utility Is Now Hunting for Deals

author: Claudia Cohen
description: France’s defense industry needs €15 billion ($17.4 billion) in new funding in the coming years if the country is to honor its commitments to NATO’s military efforts, according to state investment bank Bpifrance.
title: French Defense Sector Needs €15 Billion in Funds in NATO Effort

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russian lawmakers voted to abandon a defunct treaty with the US on the disposal of military-grade plutonium as Moscow said momentum stemming from the Alaska summit between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin has been exhausted.
title: Russia to Quit Plutonium Pact as Moscow Laments State of US Ties

author: Dan Williams, Fadwa Hodali
description: Hamas and Israel voiced cautious optimism about the prospects of ending the two-year war in Gaza, as top mediators arrived in Egypt for a third day of negotiations on US President Donald Trump’s peace plan.
title: Hamas, Israel Upbeat as Top Teams Join Talks on Ending Gaza War

author: Alice Gledhill, Julien Ponthus
description: French markets edged higher as the country’s caretaker prime minister struck a note of optimism on the budget before starting a final day of talks to form a government.
title: French Assets Climb as Traders Count Down to Talks Deadline

author: Andrew Rosati
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s poll numbers improved after a diplomatic breakthrough led to a thaw in relations with Donald Trump.
title: Detente With Trump Boosts Lula’s Approval Ratings in Brazil

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: A system of checks and balances designed to shut out the far right has instead created paralysis.
title: An End to France’s Fifth Republic Edges Closer

author: Marton Eder
description: The European Union should remove sanctions on Rasperia Trading, a company affiliated with Russian businessman Oleg Deripaska, because doing so would aid one of the bloc’s biggest builders while offering compensation for court penalties, according to the chief of Raiffeisen Bank International AG.
title: Raiffeisen Says Lifting Sanctions on Rasperia Is in the EU’s Interest

author: Michael Nienaber, Arne Delfs, John Ainger
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is expected to unify his ruling alliance behind his push for the European Union to dilute its 2035 ban on new combustion-engine vehicles in talks Wednesday evening.
title: German Coalition to Unite Behind Dilution of EU Combustion Ban

author: Kriti Gupta, Daniel Basteiro
description: Bank of Spain Governor José Luis Escrivá said the economy’s drivers of growth are shifting toward domestic demand, but the country has yet to see a tailwind of European Union recovery fund aid.
title: Spain Has Yet to See Growth Tailwind From EU Aid, Escrivá Says

author: Alice Atkins, Alice Gledhill
description: Bank of America Corp. is keeping its European rates trading desks fully staffed over the end-of-year period to be ready for potential volatility linked to a regulatory shift in the €1.9 trillion ($2.2 trillion) Dutch pension system.
title: BofA Scraps Year-End Vacations for Traders on Dutch Pension Risk

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: The Swiss government extended its support for companies that reduce working hours because of a demand slump from US tariffs.
title: Switzerland Extends Short-Time Work Support Due to US Tariffs

author: Macarena Munoz Montijano
description: UBS Group AG is gaining some momentum in its effort to water down the capital requirements contained in government-backed reforms, Deutsche Bank analysts said.
title: UBS Gaining Some Support in Swiss Debate, Deutsche Bank Says

author: Gregory Korte
description: More than a quarter million federal employees didn’t receive their scheduled paychecks this week as the US government shutdown enters its second week.
title: Federal Workers Go Unpaid, Adding Pressure to End Government Shutdown

author: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan
description: Republican US Representative Elise Stefanik is inching closer to running against New York Governor Kathy Hochul next year, saying the Democrat’s endorsement of Zohran Mamdani for New York City mayor has created an opening.
title: Stefanik Sees Mamdani Mayoral Bid as Fuel for NY Governor’s Race

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: European Union officials see new US demands for concessions as well as other measures as potentially undercutting a recent agreement that brought the allies back from the brink of a trade war.
title: EU Sees New US Trade Demands Hollowing Out Deal Struck by Trump

author: Firat Kozok, Beril Akman
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said state lender Halkbank’s legal case in the US is due to be resolved following recent talks with President Donald Trump, prompting bank shares to rise.
title: Turkey’s Erdogan Says Halkbank US Case to End After Trump Talks

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: The Bank of Thailand unexpectedly kept its key interest rate unchanged at the first policy meeting under new Governor Vitai Ratanakorn, defying expectations for another cut as officials preserve policy space amid a fragile economy and strong baht.
title: Thailand Unexpectedly Holds Rate Under New Chief; Baht Gains

author: Lucy White
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he wants the UK’s free trade agreement with India implemented “as soon as humanly possible,” as the two major economies deepen ties while US pursues a more protectionist trade agenda.
title: Starmer Pushes for Quick Implementation of UK-India Trade Pact

author: William Horobin, Jenny Che
description: Outgoing French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu expressed optimism that an an accord can be reached to allow the formation of a new government without fully endorsing a new proposal to rethink a controversial pension law as demanded by the Socialists.
title: French Premier Expresses Optimism on Resolving Political Crisis

author: Philip Heijmans
description: The US Senate confirmed Donald Trump’s nominee for ambassador to Singapore after a contentious confirmation process in which he struggled to answer questions about the city-state and its ties to Washington.
title: Senate OKs Trump Envoy to Singapore After Contentious Vetting

author: Candido Mendes, Monique Vanek
description: The continent is positioning itself as a pivotal player in the future of global agriculture, and investors are taking notice.
title: Trump’s Global Trade Chaos Creates an Opportunity for African Farmers

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Australia and Singapore are in discussions to boost bilateral defense ties, including enhanced reciprocal access to naval and air bases, Prime Minister Lawrence Wong said on Wednesday.
title: Australia and Singapore in Talks for Reciprocal Defense Access
